Browse the source code of netbsd/external/ibm-public/postfix/dist/src/global/mkmap_open.c

1/* $NetBSD: mkmap_open.c,v 1.2 2017/02/14 01:16:45 christos Exp $ */
2
3/*++
4/* NAME
5/* mkmap_open 3
6/* SUMMARY
7/* create or rewrite database, generic interface
8/* SYNOPSIS
9/* #include <mkmap.h>
10/*
11/* typedef struct MKMAP {
12/* DICT_OPEN_FN open; /* dict_xx_open() */
13/* DICT *dict; /* dict_xx_open() result */
14/* void (*after_open) (struct MKMAP *); /* may be null */
15/* void (*after_close) (struct MKMAP *); /* may be null */
16/* int multi_writer; /* multi-writer safe */
17/* } MKMAP;
18/*
19/* MKMAP *mkmap_open(type, path, open_flags, dict_flags)
20/* char *type;
21/* char *path;
22/* int open_flags;
23/* int dict_flags;
24/*
25/* void mkmap_append(mkmap, key, value, lineno)
26/* MKMAP *mkmap;
27/* char *key;
28/* char *value;
29/* int lineno;
30/*
31/* void mkmap_close(mkmap)
32/* MKMAP *mkmap;
33/*
34/* typedef MKMAP *(*MKMAP_OPEN_FN) (const char *);
35/* typedef MKMAP_OPEN_FN *(*MKMAP_OPEN_EXTEND_FN) (const char *);
36/*
37/* void mkmap_open_register(type, open_fn)
38/* const char *type;
39/* MKMAP_OPEN_FN open_fn;
40/*
41/* MKMAP_OPEN_EXTEND_FN mkmap_open_extend(call_back)
42/* MKMAP_OPEN_EXTEND_FN call_back;
43/* DESCRIPTION
44/* This module implements support for creating Postfix databases.
45/* It is a dict(3) wrapper that adds global locking to dict-level
46/* routines where appropriate.
47/*
48/* mkmap_open() creates or truncates the named database, after
49/* appending the appropriate suffixes to the specified filename.
50/* Before the database is updated, it is locked for exclusive
51/* access, and signal delivery is suspended.
52/* See dict(3) for a description of \fBopen_flags\fR and
53/* \fBdict_flags\fR. All errors are fatal.
54/*
55/* mkmap_append() appends the named (key, value) pair to the
56/* database. Update errors are fatal; duplicate keys are ignored
57/* (but a warning is issued).
58/* \fBlineno\fR is used for diagnostics.
59/*
60/* mkmap_close() closes the database, releases any locks,
61/* and resumes signal delivery. All errors are fatal.
62/*
63/* mkmap_open_register() adds support for a new database type.
64/*
65/* mkmap_open_extend() registers a call-back function that looks
66/* up the mkmap open() function for a database type that is not
67/* registered, or null in case of error. The result value is the
68/* last previously-registered call-back or null. A mkmap open()
69/* function is cached after it is looked up through this extension
70/* mechanism.
71/* SEE ALSO
72/* sigdelay(3) suspend/resume signal delivery
73/* LICENSE
74/* .ad
75/* .fi
76/* The Secure Mailer license must be distributed with this software.
77/* AUTHOR(S)
78/* Wietse Venema
79/* IBM T.J. Watson Research
80/* P.O. Box 704
81/* Yorktown Heights, NY 10598, USA
82/*--*/
83
84/* System library. */
85
86#include <sys_defs.h>
87#include <unistd.h>
88#include <string.h>
89
90/* Utility library. */
91
92#include <msg.h>
93#include <htable.h>
94#include <dict.h>
95#include <dict_db.h>
96#include <dict_cdb.h>
97#include <dict_dbm.h>
98#include <dict_lmdb.h>
99#include <dict_sdbm.h>
100#include <dict_proxy.h>
101#include <dict_fail.h>
102#include <sigdelay.h>
103#include <mymalloc.h>
104#include <stringops.h>
105
106/* Global library. */
107
108#include "mkmap.h"
109
110 /*
111 * Information about available database types. Here, we list only those map
112 * types that support "bulk create" operations.
113 *
114 * We use a different table (in dict_open.c and mail_dict.c) when querying maps
115 * or when making incremental updates.
116 */
117typedef struct {
118 const char *type;
119 MKMAP_OPEN_FN before_open;
120} MKMAP_OPEN_INFO;
121
122static const MKMAP_OPEN_INFO mkmap_open_info[] = {
123#ifndef USE_DYNAMIC_MAPS
124#ifdef HAS_CDB
125 DICT_TYPE_CDB, mkmap_cdb_open,
126#endif
127#ifdef HAS_SDBM
128 DICT_TYPE_SDBM, mkmap_sdbm_open,
129#endif
130#ifdef HAS_LMDB
131 DICT_TYPE_LMDB, mkmap_lmdb_open,
132#endif
133#endif /* !USE_DYNAMIC_MAPS */
134#ifdef HAS_DBM
135 DICT_TYPE_DBM, mkmap_dbm_open,
136#endif
137#ifdef HAS_DB
138 DICT_TYPE_HASH, mkmap_hash_open,
139 DICT_TYPE_BTREE, mkmap_btree_open,
140#endif
141 DICT_TYPE_FAIL, mkmap_fail_open,
142 0,
143};
144
145static HTABLE *mkmap_open_hash;
146
147static MKMAP_OPEN_EXTEND_FN mkmap_open_extend_hook = 0;
148
149/* mkmap_open_init - one-off initialization */
150
151static void mkmap_open_init(void)
152{
153 static const char myname[] = "mkmap_open_init";
154 const MKMAP_OPEN_INFO *mp;
155
156 if (mkmap_open_hash != 0)
157 msg_panic("%s: multiple initialization", myname);
158 mkmap_open_hash = htable_create(10);
159
160 for (mp = mkmap_open_info; mp->type; mp++)
161 htable_enter(mkmap_open_hash, mp->type, (void *) mp);
162}
163
164/* mkmap_open_register - register dictionary type */
165
166void mkmap_open_register(const char *type, MKMAP_OPEN_FN open_fn)
167{
168 static const char myname[] = "mkmap_open_register";
169 MKMAP_OPEN_INFO *mp;
170 HTABLE_INFO *ht;
171
172 if (mkmap_open_hash == 0)
173 mkmap_open_init();
174 if (htable_find(mkmap_open_hash, type))
175 msg_panic("%s: database type exists: %s", myname, type);
176 mp = (MKMAP_OPEN_INFO *) mymalloc(sizeof(*mp));
177 mp->before_open = open_fn;
178 ht = htable_enter(mkmap_open_hash, type, (void *) mp);
179 mp->type = ht->key;
180}
181
182/* mkmap_open_extend - register alternate lookup function */
183
184MKMAP_OPEN_EXTEND_FN mkmap_open_extend(MKMAP_OPEN_EXTEND_FN new_cb)
185{
186 MKMAP_OPEN_EXTEND_FN old_cb;
187
188 old_cb = mkmap_open_extend_hook;
189 mkmap_open_extend_hook = new_cb;
190 return (old_cb);
191}
192
193/* mkmap_append - append entry to map */
194
195#undef mkmap_append
196
197void mkmap_append(MKMAP *mkmap, const char *key, const char *value)
198{
199 DICT *dict = mkmap->dict;
200
201 if (dict_put(dict, key, value) != 0 && dict->error != 0)
202 msg_fatal("%s:%s: update failed", dict->type, dict->name);
203}
204
205/* mkmap_close - close database */
206
207void mkmap_close(MKMAP *mkmap)
208{
209
210 /*
211 * Close the database.
212 */
213 dict_close(mkmap->dict);
214
215 /*
216 * Do whatever special processing is needed after closing the database,
217 * such as releasing a global exclusive lock on the database file.
218 * Individual Postfix dict modules implement locking only for individual
219 * record operations, because most Postfix applications don't need global
220 * exclusive locks.
221 */
222 if (mkmap->after_close)
223 mkmap->after_close(mkmap);
224
225 /*
226 * Resume signal delivery.
227 */
228 if (mkmap->multi_writer == 0)
229 sigresume();
230
231 /*
232 * Cleanup.
233 */
234 myfree((void *) mkmap);
235}
236
237/* mkmap_open - create or truncate database */
238
239MKMAP *mkmap_open(const char *type, const char *path,
240 int open_flags, int dict_flags)
241{
242 MKMAP *mkmap;
243 const MKMAP_OPEN_INFO *mp;
244 MKMAP_OPEN_FN open_fn;
245
246 /*
247 * Find out what map type to use.
248 */
249 if (mkmap_open_hash == 0)
250 mkmap_open_init();
251 if ((mp = (MKMAP_OPEN_INFO *) htable_find(mkmap_open_hash, type)) == 0) {
252 if (mkmap_open_extend_hook != 0 &&
253 (open_fn = mkmap_open_extend_hook(type)) != 0) {
254 mkmap_open_register(type, open_fn);
255 mp = (MKMAP_OPEN_INFO *) htable_find(mkmap_open_hash, type);
256 }
257 if (mp == 0)
258 msg_fatal("unsupported map type for this operation: %s", type);
259 }
260 if (msg_verbose)
261 msg_info("open %s %s", type, path);
262
263 /*
264 * Do whatever before-open initialization is needed, such as acquiring a
265 * global exclusive lock on an existing database file. Individual Postfix
266 * dict modules implement locking only for individual record operations,
267 * because most Postfix applications don't need global exclusive locks.
268 */
269 mkmap = mp->before_open(path);
270
271 /*
272 * Delay signal delivery, so that we won't leave the database in an
273 * inconsistent state if we can avoid it.
274 */
275 sigdelay();
276
277 /*
278 * Truncate the database upon open, and update it. Read-write mode is
279 * needed because the underlying routines read as well as write. We
280 * explicitly clobber lock_fd to trigger a fatal error when a map wants
281 * to unlock the database after individual transactions: that would
282 * result in race condition problems. We clobbber stat_fd as well,
283 * because that, too, is used only for individual-transaction clients.
284 */
285 mkmap->dict = mkmap->open(path, open_flags, dict_flags);
286 mkmap->dict->lock_fd = -1; /* XXX just in case */
287 mkmap->dict->stat_fd = -1; /* XXX just in case */
288 mkmap->dict->flags |= DICT_FLAG_DUP_WARN;
289 mkmap->multi_writer = (mkmap->dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_MULTI_WRITER);
290
291 /*
292 * Do whatever post-open initialization is needed, such as acquiring a
293 * global exclusive lock on a database file that did not exist.
294 * Individual Postfix dict modules implement locking only for individual
295 * record operations, because most Postfix applications don't need global
296 * exclusive locks.
297 */
298 if (mkmap->after_open)
299 mkmap->after_open(mkmap);
300
301 /*
302 * Wrap the dictionary for UTF-8 syntax checks and casefolding.
303 */
304 if ((mkmap->dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_UTF8_ACTIVE) == 0
305 && DICT_NEED_UTF8_ACTIVATION(util_utf8_enable, dict_flags))
306 mkmap->dict = dict_utf8_activate(mkmap->dict);
307
308 /*
309 * Resume signal delivery if multi-writer safe.
310 */
311 if (mkmap->multi_writer)
312 sigresume();
313
314 return (mkmap);
315}
